In opposition to these skilled warriors, the Elementalist and his trio of Stone Constructs are native to the Lockfire Swamp, as is the Dryad Witch and her Wood Construct, and the Lizardfolk Queen and her entourage of three Lizardfolk Warriors.

As a Champions Combat System game, Champions of Akathena: Blood and Magic seamlessly integrates with all other games built using the same system, including Champions of Akathena: Into the Wild.

—description from the publisher

Name: Champions of Akathena: Into the Wild
Description:
Champions of Akathena: Into the Wild is an exciting, fantasy combat board game that uses the Champions Combat System™. This complete boxed game contains everything two to six players need to start playing out exciting tabletop battles, including a complete copy of the core Champions Combat System™ rules.

Set in the fantastical, war-torn world of Akathena, this boxed set contains maps for two different battlefields, the Greywolf Forest and the Heartland Mountains. Players will be able to choose from six different champions who hail from these lands, each with their associated reinforcements. The Huntsman and his trusty Wolf are native to the wilds of the Greywolf Forest, as are the Elven Archer and her Snake companion, and the Elven Swiftblade and her Panther ally. In opposition to these deadly hunters, the Shinobi and pair of Genin hail from the Heartland Mountains, as does the eccentric Gnome Alchemist and her two Gunslinger companions, and the Shapeshifter and her pair of pet Savage Cats.

As a Champions Combat System game, Champions of Akathena: Into the Wild seamlessly integrates with all other games built using the same system, including Champions of Akathena: Blood and Magic.

—description from the publisher

Name: 9 Figure
Description:
9 Figure is a fast and simple dexterity game. Every card has a picture of animal, object, or person, consisting mainly of three shapes and colors.

A player rolls two dice. Then all players should simultaneously think and take one correct figure based on the combination of the dice. The player that finds the correct answer will get the point.  The player who gets 5 points first wins.

—description from publisher

Name: Batyskaf
Description:
Be ready for an underwater adventure! Travel with a bathyscaphe and take photos of the most interesting animals! If you dive deeply under water, there is a chance that you will catch extremely rare and fascinating specimens. The one who creates the best photo collection and gets the most pearls wins the game.

The game teaches good planning and trains the skill of estimating risk.

Object.
During the game, you dive with bathyscaphe to get the most interesting animal tokens. You use oxygen cards for this. Bathyscaphe submerge and emerge can be done at one time - as long as you have the right number of oxygen bubbles.

The end of the game.
The game is coming to the end when there are no oxygen cards in the deck. Count all the pearls that are on your animal tokens.
The winner will receive the most points for the collected pearls.

—user summary

Name: Dungeons Of Old
Description:
Dungeons of Old is a unique take on a deck-building game for one to four players,  in which you take control of your very own ragtag band of adventurers and turn them into a formidable fighting force to take down monsters, snatch up loot and buy new cards on your way to defeat one of FIVE Dungeon Bosses.

Players will start with the same ten card deck, featuring characters, equipment and spells, to enter their first dungeon. There they'll compete with each other to fight, defeat and direct monsters and snatch up more than their fair share of the loot they guard.

The aim of the game is to make more money from your adventuring efforts than the other players at the table and win ultimate glory in defeating the dungeon boss!

—description from the designer

Name: Fear God & Dread Nought: 2nd Edition – Tactical Naval Warfare 1906-1925
Description:
Fear God & Dread Nought 2nd Ed. covers the period centered around World War I. This game uses the same terms and game system as other Admiralty Trilogy games (Harpoon, Command at Sea, and Dawn of the Battleship). Those familiar with any of these games will have no difficulty stepping into the First World War. A jumpstart scenario allows the novice to play quickly, with several scenarios also being optimized for solitaire play. While comprehensive, the rules are easy to follow for experienced gamers and novices alike. That makes it easy to learn and you know it will be accurate.

Emphasizing playability as well as scrupulous historical accuracy, research for the game has involved many of the best naval historians in the world. The 40+ scenarios in the High Seas Fleet booklet include the well-known big battles like Jutland (broken into three parts, as well as the complete engagment) and Dogger Bank, and many smaller fights. The scenario often include variants, covering historical "almosts" and "what ifs".

—description from the publisher

Name: Breaking Ball: Gaelic Football Board Game
Description:
Breaking Ball is a Sports themed game based on one of the Irish National Sports - Gaelic Football. It is a card and dice game with an emphasis on tactical use of your team players throughout a game.

Each team has 15 'players' in various positions throughout the playing pitch from Goalkeeper to Full Forwards. It follows the proper rules of Gaelic Football.

Each team tries to win possession of the football and beat their opponent in that 'zone' of the playing field before passing the ball via various attacking cards, while their opponent tries to intercept the ball by counteracting their moves with their defending cards.

Once a player gets past their opponent and successfully  moves the ball through the playing field zones into their attacking half of the field they can attempt to shoot for a point from long range (using dice, the further out harder it is to score) or they can try and work their way in to shoot for a goal or an easy point, whilst their opponent tries to dispossess them of the ball (by means of card moves). A goal represents 3 points and a point is, well 1 point! (a point in Gaelic Football is kicking the ball over the crossbar and much easier to accomplish than scoring a goal).

Players can get yellow carded and red cards sent off - there are star players on each team with added skills and the tactical element of how you deploy your players can have a big impact on the outcome.

Its a 2 player game (2 teams) but players do join together to manage a team against other opponents.

Tactics is a big part of the game and how you deploy your team and counteract your opponents star players will have a bearing on the outcome.

So game play follows the rules to move up and down the field as each player tries to work their way into a possible scoring zone.

Play in a real game lasts 30 minutes per half but players can decide a time limit. The winner is the player with the highest combined score (goals and points) at the end of the allotted time.

Name: River Wars: WWI Naval Battles on the Rivers and Lakes of Europe
Description:
River Wars

WW1 Naval Battles on the Rivers and Lakes of Europe.

A supplement for Steamer Wars covering naval engagements on the Danube and other European waters.

The supplement includes a host of new rules covering:

     mines and 
     torpedoes, 
     troops on shore, 
     land based features and targets and 
     the riverine environment.  


Data tables are included for over thirty new ship and vessel types from the navies of:

     the United Kingdom, 
     Germany, 
     Russia, 
     Serbia, 
     Romania and 
     Turkey. 


Note : The new rules presented here are the same as those in War on the Great Rivers

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Black Widow Hero Pack
Description:
KGB assassin, agent of S.H.I.E.L.D., villain, hero: Natasha Romanoff has taken on many roles, and played many sides in a life shrouded in mystery. But throughout every new stage of life, Natasha has developed a unique set of skills that she now uses in the role of the Black Widow, international super-spy. Soon, you'll be able to make use of these skills as you battle villains from across the Marvel Universe.

The Black Widow Hero Pack includes a pre-built deck for Black Widow utilizing the Justice aspect, the Taskmaster nemesis set, and additional cards to help increase your deck building options! With well-rounded base stats and a Preparation card for every occasion, Black Widow is always ready for what’s coming next!

-description from publisher's website
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

Name: Flight Time
Description:
In the economic game Flight Time, you are an airline company competing with other airlines for customers around the country.  You start with a small airplane and a hub city.  Throughout the game you'll be trying to:  increase the size of your fleet, upgrade your fleet, purchase flight times between two cities, keep your planes fueled, and either rent hangar space for your airplanes that are waiting for demand or reassign your planes to a different route that is more lucrative.

There will be a map of the USA with cities connected to each other by lines.  Those cities will have space (hangars) for small plane tokens.  Above the connection line will be flight times, which are spaces for tokens to claim to be able to fly the route.  Below the connection line will be space for passenger tokens to be placed, showing demand for the route.

When you buy a plane you will receive a small plane board with a number of seats available for passenger tokens to fit into, as well as tracks next to the plane showing fuel status and amenities level this plane is at.  In addition, you will have tokens to indicate seats that are upgraded to first class seats, providing more income on your flight.

—description from the designer

Name: Fields of Fire: Fast Play Rules
Description:
Fields of Fire: Fast Play Rules is the fastest way to get started with the system!

You can be up and playing your first game in under five minutes.

Fields of Fire is a miniatures game for combat from 1975 to present.

For 1:285 scale up to 20 mm minis.
One miniature equals one vehicle.

—user summary

Name: Fields of Fire: Crucible of Force
Description:
Crucible of Force uses the Award Winning Fields of Fire game engine to bring our fast paced, yet accurate play style to the Second World War.

These rules cover European Theater combat from the beginning of the war to the Summer of 1943.  
Also included are play charts and other play aids to make your gaming experience more enjoyable.

The rules cover all aspects of game play, from movement and shooting to command and control, but are written in such a way as to allow the player to design a scenario as simple or as advanced as desired.  
Novice players appreciate the easy to understand format, while veterans appreciate a fast-paced game that maintains real-world accuracy for their historical or what-if scenarios.

Playable at either 6mm or 15mm, Crucible of Force allows you to use the scale you prefer for your game.  
Each miniature represents 1 tank and infantry basing is flexible.  
The game plays as well for platoon level combat as it does for a battalion.  
These rules cover equipment from the USA, USSR, Great Britain, France, Poland, Germany, and Italy.

—description from the publisher

Name: Time's Up!: Football
Description:
With Time’s Up!, guess football-related words in 3 rounds, first by describing them then with a single word and finally by mime. Hurry up, give the best clues so that your team finds a maximum of answers before the end of the hourglass.

If you're a team player, Time’s Up! Football is the game for you! Have fun discovering with family or friends the 40 new object cards evoking football.

Hum and make noise to guess as many cards as possible! Be Soccer with Time’s Up! Football.

—description from the publisher

Name: Superhéroes Marvel: Juego de cartas no coleccionable
Description:
Superhéroes Marvel is a game of non-collectible cards you intend emulate the fighting between heroes and comic villains, made by and for fans that combines cards and dices.

You must get the cost in points of each location where the heroes fight. They can cost 7,8,9 or 10 points according to their importance in the Marvel universe. Whoever earns more of these points is the final winner.

In addition to Heroes and locations there are Events, which allow you to alter some rules or game mechanics.

Name: Stars and Crosses: North Africa 1940-43
Description:
Stars & Crosses: North Africa is a campaign expansion for Stars & Crosses Revised Edition 1.2, the game of WW2 company-level combat in 6mm scale.

You will need a copy of the core rules to play.

This expansion includes rules for:

     dust clouds,
     desert terrain,
     digging in,
     flares,
     antitank ditches,
     desert hazards, and
     sandstorms. 


Unit counters are included for

     Italian units, plus new 
     British,
     German, and
     American units. 


Four scenarios are included.

The printables section of the PDF includes

     terrain hexes,
     markers, and
     unit counters. 


—description from the publisher

Name: Tails of Conflict
Description:
The great battle between cats and dogs rages on in the card game, Tails of Conflict.

Lead a team of three adorable champions of either cats or dogs (or a mix of both) to battle other teams in this elegantly simple yet fun, competitive card game.

Starting with a deck of ten cards of mostly gold, you will need to buy cards from the Armoury to help your champions gain victory over your rivals.

Combat is resolved with dice. Each champion starts with 1 dice in attack, defence and speed. Equipment such as weapons and armour add dice, while skills and events add dice or allow rerolls.

A champion is captured and taken out of the game once they have 5 hit tokens on them. Capture all 3 of your opponents champions to win the game!

Do you have what it takes to lead your team to victory? Join the war and pledge your allegiance today!

Name: Croix de Guerre: ASL Module 10a
Description:
CROIX DE GUERRE brings the French order of battle back into print and adds DINANT: ROMMEL AT THE MEUSE, the brand new Historical ASL campaign on the crossing of the Meuse in May 1940. In addition to the original eight CdG scenarios and the ten new DINANT scenarios, CROIX DE GUERRE includes 22 more out-of-print French scenarios updated for balance and clarity plus a bonus 1944 scenario on the Dinant map. Also included are mapboards 42 and 43 and a revised National Capabilities Chart.

CROIX DE GUERRE not only provides the standard French blue counters for use in 1939-40, but also provides for the first time unique infantry counters for the Vichy French regime’s overseas colonies (two-tone French-blue-in-German-blue) and for the Free French (standard French blue with a Cross of Lorraine). That means all the personnel, weapons, and uniquely French vehicle counters used by French forces throughout World War II, as well as the detailed Chapter H historical notes to accompany the counters and revised Chapter A rules to reflect the new French infantry counters.

DINANT: ROMMEL AT THE MEUSE takes players through the rapid movement of Erwin Rommel’s Panzer-Division 7 across the Meuse and through the “impenetrable” Bois d’Ardennes and shows the fighting at the southernmost portion of the river crossing at the town of Dinant during 11-14 May, 1940. Facing the Germans were the exhausted men of the 18th Infantry Division, who had marched almost 50 miles in the preceding three days. High Command had stripped from them all their 60mm mortars, almost half of their motorized transport, and many of their 25mm anti-tank guns, giving those to units “more likely to face action.”

DINANT: ROMMEL AT THE MEUSE features two historical 22Ë×34Ë map sections with several new terrain types—Road Tunnels, Railroad Embankment Underpasses, 15th Century Fortresses, Weirs, and Retaining Walls. The 10 scenarios showcase fighting at and around the area of the crossing. Players will navigate through a maze of narrow streets alongside the Meuse River at the bottom of 90´ high cliffs and then climb to the plateau above. The Campaign Game will also see the German player building pontoon bridges and assembling ferries for men, tanks, and equipment to cross the river, all while under fire.

CROIX DE GUERRE is therefore much more than a mere reprint of its predecessor and showcases the French army as never before. Vive la France!

Contains:

        11 countersheets 
        two 22" x 34" maps (for DINANT: ROMMEL AT THE MEUSE)
        two 8" x 22" standard ASL geomorphic maps (42 and 43)
        French Chapter H and revised French Chapter A pages
        Chapter DN (with the DINANT HASL rules)
        41 ASL scenarios (including 11 for the DINANT HASL)
        two DINANT HASL chapter dividers
        one revised National Capabilities Chart


The 22 out-of-print French scenarios included are:
A52 Swan Song
A64 Chateau de Quesnoy
A66 Counterstroke at Stonne
A89 First Day of Diadem
A94 Last Defense Line
A96 In Rommel's Wake
A104 In Front of the Storm
A108 Sudden Death
A119 Showdown in Syria
G46 Triumph Atop Taraldsvikfjell
U Chance d'une Affaire
J35 Siam Sambal
J44 Audacity!
J45 The Last Roadblock
J69 The Army at the Edge of the World
J70 Just an Illusion
J76 Ultimate Treachery
J90 The Time of Humiliations
U1 The French Decide to Fight
U20 Fighting at the World’s Edge
U21 The French Perimeter
WO2 Failure to Communicate

Note: Box says copyright 2019 but actually released in 2020.

(from MMP website)

Name: Combat Command: Battalion Level Rules for World War II – Advanced Game
Description:
Combat Command - Advanced Game

This addition to the innovative Combat Command system includes the full advanced game and optional rules which allow players to tailor their games to whatever level of simulation detail they wish.

The Advanced Game builds on but does not change the rules from the Basic Game. 
The Advanced rules include additional terrain rules, extra capabilities for troops including Engineer, Recon and Anti-Tank.  
These rules also expand Commanders capabilities and add new command functions.  
New rules also cover National Differences in order to give a unique flavor to the armies fielded by the United Kingdom, the United States, the Soviet Union and Germany.

The optional rules add a new level of simulation detail including rules to reflect the difficulty of using long barreled weapons in urban settings and a complete list of Engineer tasks from digging foxholes to building bridges.

Despite the increased level of simulation detail the system retains the logical and easy to use mechanics of the original game making it ideal for club or convention play.  Easy to introduce to new players yet a satisfying and complete game for even the most battle tested World War II gamer.

This section requires a copy of Combat Command - the Basic Game to use.

As an added bonus this packet also includes Saint Lo to the Siegfried line a set of Army Lists covering July to November 1944.  These lists allow players to recreate historical Battlegroups in evenly matched battles.  In addition a section covers how to create well balanced battles based on actual historical match ups.  This section can be used with virtually any platoon based system.

—description from the publisher

Name: Uprising: Ashes – Part 2 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
Description:
If you stand on Manta beach as dawn breaks on the Andes, you can see a twinkling thread stretching above the city’s skyline. As faint as passing imagination, but reaching ever upwards. A golden rope tying the earth to the heavens, the past to the future. Frayed by the vicissitudes of corporate war and the battering of terrorist cabals, but patched and repaired.

Whole.

Change is inevitable and comes in many forms. Not even the strongest reinforced buckyweave will last forever. The events of the past have pushed and pulled. Controversial measures have been enforced from above, attempting to lock down society into the elite’s desired shape. In reaction, a groundswell of unified outrage has risen up from below, allowing Runners to fight back from directions never seen before. As these conflicts run their course, hope begins to permeate New Angeles. Some take solace that the citadel of the Beanstalk did not fall, others breathe easy as the corporate grip loosens. It’s a new world, and everything is on the table.

Things are looking up.

This is the second fan expansion for Android: Netrunner released by NISEI, and the final part of the Ashes cycle.

Name: King of the West: The Vigilant
Description:
There’s somethin’ in the town of Backwater that don’t belong. It fills the air with energy, like it feels before a storm. Except this storm ain’t one of wind and rain, but bullets and blood.

King of the West is a weird west themed area control card game. Three different sets of characters will be available at launch. One set can be played as a 2-3 player 18-card area control game, but multiple sets will allow for up to 9 players with the modified rules variant.

For the area control variant setup, nine building cards are randomly played on a 3x3 grid to make up the town. Six buildings are generic locations and the other three are the unique target locations. Since they are played randomly, the location of these target buildings will be different in every game.

Players can take three actions on their turn: Claim a Building, Move, and Shootout! Shootouts are how you remove opponents from the buildings you want. You do this by trying to get into your opponent's head and outthink them using a nuanced rock-paper-scissors combat system.

The game ends when either a player starts their turn controlling all three target locations or they are the only player controlling any buildings in the town.

With multiple sets and a larger player count, your still fighting over buildings, but instead of gaining a new location every turn, you are limited to what you start with. Players can't be eliminated though and when you run out of your buildings, you can steal someone elses. Other than that, combat works in the same way and the winner is the last person (or team!) left with claimed buildings.

—description from the designer


King of the West card game set 1: The Vigilant, including The Drifter, The Gambler, The Baron, and their locations.

Name: Zombicide (2nd Edition): Chronicles Survivor Set
Description:
Chronicles Survivor Set brings 12 Survivors figures and ID cards to be played with Zombicide: 2nd Edition, as well as bring Zombicide: Chronicles RPG to a deeper level of immersion, featuring the characters that you choose to face the zombie apocalypse with in glorious plastic form!

12 Survivors figures and ID cards: 
Amado (BMX Rider)

Erin (Bus Driver)
Glenn (Wheelchair-bound Foreman)
Hellen (Butcher)
Kiki (Postwoman)
Lateesha (Doctor)
Mark (Baseball Player)
Preston (Clerk)
Reno (Veteran)
Shamsia (Graffiti Artist)
Yuka (Kendoka)

Name: Zombicide (2nd Edition): Urban Legends Abominations
Description:
The Urban Legends Abominations pack brings 4 different Abominations and their cards. The Killer Clown, Chupacabra, Sewer Crocodile, and Abductor. You've heard of them. You feared them. And now, it is time to fight them!

—description from the publisher
